shinytest2 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Remote control a Shiny app running in a headless browser

Source: R/shiny-driver.R
ShinyDriver2.Rd

This class starts a Shiny app in a new R session, along with a chromote headless browser that can be used to simulate user actions. This provides a full simulation of a Shiny app so that you can test user interactions with a live app.

Method expectUpdate()

Usage

ShinyDriver2$expectUpdate(
  output,
  ...,
  timeout = 3000,
  iotype = c("auto", "input", "output")
)

Arguments

iotype

Type of the Shiny widget. Usually shinytest2 finds the widgets by their name, so this is only needed if you use the same name for an input and output widget.

Method new()

Usage

ShinyDriver2$new(
  path = ".",
  ...,
  load_timeout = NULL,
  screenshot = TRUE,
  check_names = TRUE,
  name = NULL,
  variant = getOption("shinytest2.variant", os_name_and_r_version()),
  debug = c("none", "all", debug_log_types()),
  seed = NULL,
  clean_logs = TRUE,
  shiny_args = list(),
  render_args = NULL,
  options = list()
)

Arguments

name

Name of a shiny widget.

ShinyDriver2$setInputs(

Method waitForValue()

Usage

ShinyDriver2$waitForValue(
  name,
  ignore = list(NULL, ""),
  iotype = c("input", "output", "export"),
  timeout = 10000,
  check_interval = 400
)

Arguments

name

Name of a shiny widget.

iotype

Type of the Shiny widget. Usually shinytest2 finds the widgets by their name, so this is only needed if you use the same name for an input and output widget.
